byline.original: By MICHAEL D. SHEAR and NICK CORASANITI
byline.contributor: Michael D. Shear reported from Washington, and Nick Corasaniti from Ashburn, Va. Alexander Burns contributed reporting from New York.

abstract: Pres Obama urges Republicans to withdraw their endorsements of Donald J Trump for president, flatly calling Trump 'unfit to serve' as nation's 45th president; comments represent unprecedented condemnation of presidential candidate by sitting president.
snippet: During a news conference with the prime minister of Singapore, the president said the Republican nominee was “woefully unprepared to do this job.”...
lead_paragraph: During a news conference with the prime minister of Singapore, the president said the Republican nominee was “woefully unprepared to do this job.”

headline.main: Obama Says Republicans Should Withdraw Support for Trump
headline.print_headline: Obama Urges  G.O.P. Leaders to Snub Trump
